title.narrative: REHABILITATION OF CARIBBEAN HEAVILY CONTAMINATED BAYS

description.narrative: Demonstration of Innovative Approaches to the rehabilitation of heavily contaminated bays in the Wider Caribbean. PIMS 1443 IW FSP Cuba
Demonstration of Innovative Approaches to the rehabilitation of heavily contaminated bays in the Wider Caribbean.
independent political entity
Energy - policy, planning and administration
To promote and facilitate sustainable development and management of the Havana Bay by the implementation of innovative approaches for reducing the input of priority international waters contaminants.
Reduction of pollution levels and pollutant discharges into Havana Bay, especially nutrients, with efficiency of removal of 50-70%.

comment.narrative: Nutrients N: 32 mg/l P: 9 mg/l
Nutrients N < 10 mg/l P < 4 mg/l

2006 2007 2008 2009 2010 2011 2012 2013 2014 2015
N (mg/l) 0.137 0.094 0.050 0.0852 0.1410 0.1045 0.1222 0.1666 0,1778 0,2128
P (mg/l) 0.068 0.093 0.077 0.1250 0.1333 0.1060 0.1162 0.1497 0,1209 0,1581
This information was obtained through the Environmental Monitoring System for the Havana Bay, which provides as a systematic task, monitoring key indicators of ecosystem´s quality. The objectives of this monitoring are to define the current level of pollution in the Bay and its evolution due to control and mitigation measures of pollution that have been implemented.
This information merely aims to provide a snapshot of the current ecosystem status. The results of the ammonium nitrogen showed an increase in the three measurement levels compared to the previous years.
In the case of the concentration’s total phosphorus, the results were higher than the previous years in surface and middle level. This indicator shows a slight tendency to the increase in the superficial level, however in the middle and bottom level the tendency is to decrease.
The annual average concentrations of ammonia nitrogen (N-NH4) at all measurement levels were higher than 3.57 mol L-1, which is the minimum limit for considering the poor quality water according to the Cuban Standard NC 25: 1999 for the assessment of water resources for fishery. The average concentrations of total phosphorus (PT) in the superficial level were higher than 2.5 mol L-1, considered as indicative inferior limit of eutrophic systems corresponding to the Cuban Standard mentioned above. The nutrients increased with respect to the previous year, and a tendency to the slight increase is observed in the last four years.
The concentrations of nutrients in general continue high. Long-term sustainability of all measures to rehabilitate the bay is of great importance, as well as the continuity of the implemented environmental monitoring system. The entry into operation of the wastewater treatment plant Luyano IV and the others wastewaters treatment plants which are in construction at the moment in the tributary basin of the bay, will contribute to decrease the nutrient concentrations in the Havana bay.

description.narrative: The demonstration plant is established thus reducing nutrients to Havana Bay and the Wider Caribbean.
Reduction of pollution levels and pollutant discharges into Havana Bay, especially nutrients, with efficiency of removal of 50-70%.

comment.narrative: Nutrients N: 32 mg/l P: 9 mg/l
All designs and plans completed
All designs and plans completed in 2006

description.narrative: Reduction of pollution levels and pollutant discharges into Havana Bay, especially nutrients, with efficiency of removal of 50-70%.

comment.narrative: Nutrients N: 32 mg/l P: 9 mg/l
Bidding process finished
The purchase and the delivery of the plant technology was completed in 2007

description.narrative: Reduction of pollution levels and pollutant discharges into Havana Bay, especially nutrients, with efficiency of removal of 50-70%.

comment.narrative: Nutrients N: 32 mg/l P: 9 mg/l
Construction of the Plant finalized - 100%

This project´s outcome has reached 78% of implementation. During the period, several actions aimed at the WTP Luyanó IV´s finalization have been carried out.
the completion of 34 objects has continued (Inlet registry, main pumping station, pretreatment building, sand remover/degreaser, flow meter, distribution chamber, primary settlers 1 and 2, collection chamber, anoxic chamber, aerobic reactors - secondary settlers 1 and 2, overflow registers R-1 and R-2, air producing facility, contact tank-water reuse, chlorination building, primary sludge pumping station (including sludge and supernatant), secondary sludge pumping station (including recirculation and excess), sludge thickener, thickened sludge pumping station, anaerobic digester, digested sludge pumping station, internal sewage system, garage facility, control facility, potable water tank, external electrical networks, perimeter fencing, internal vials , external areas, laboratory – administrative facility), a total of 46 were planned for this stage, advancing to different phases of completion, in line with the approved schedule. (In the new schedule, the objects of PTR Luyanó IV´s civil works are more particularized, according to its functions).

description.narrative: Reduction of pollution levels and pollutant discharges into Havana Bay, especially nutrients, with efficiency of removal of 50-70%.

comment.narrative: Nutrients N: 32 mg/l P: 9 mg/l
Plans for operation, maintenance and monitoring under execution.

The operation and maintenance programs of WTP Luyanó IV are being developed by the National Institute of Hydraulic Resources (INRH).
During the stage has prepared the operation and maintenance programs of WTP Luyanó IV, but it is not concluded yet, due to modifications of the WTP Luyanó IV ´s executive project which are been carrying out, directed to obtain improvements in the future operation of this treatment system.
The conclusion’s operation and maintenance programs of the WTP Luyanó IV´ , have been systematically supervised in the controlled of the work.
The monitoring program, that will be implemented when the WTP Luyanó IV becomes operational, has been already prepared by the Centre for Engineering and Environmental Management of Bays (CIMAB). This program will demonstrate the fulfillment of the project’s main objective and will allow to assess the WTP Luyanó IV’s environmental impact in the Havana Bay rehabilitation.

description.narrative: Reduction of pollution levels and pollutant discharges into Havana Bay, especially nutrients, with efficiency of removal of 50-70%.

comment.narrative: Nutrients N: 32 mg/l P: 9 mg/l
To install 7.2 km.

The number of kilometers of the large diameter collectors systems installed and in operation remains at 6, 5 km. (90% of progress).
Currently, we have been working on the executive project for the entrance siphon of the WTP Luyanó IV to proceed to its construction.
The collectors systems will be concluded in 2016, according to the established chronogram.

description.narrative: Reduction of pollution levels and pollutant discharges into Havana Bay, especially nutrients, with efficiency of removal of 50-70%.

comment.narrative: Nutrients N: 32 mg/l P: 9 mg/l
62000 inhabitants

During the period have been maintained a population of 60,000 inhabitants connected to the WTP Luyanó IV ´s sewer collection system, preserving the environmental and living condition’s improvement of the population served.

description.narrative: Reduction of pollution levels and pollutant discharges into Havana Bay, especially nutrients, with efficiency of removal of 50-70%.

comment.narrative: Nutrients N: 32 mg/l P: 9 mg/l
Stakeholders consultation and awareness raising strategy designed and implemented

During the stage, the socialization, dissemination and awareness program of the project was updated, with the essential purpose of ensuring the visibility of the project´s objectives, the progress of the planned outcomes, as well as, the impact of all actions performed to achieve the purposes of the project.
A systematic upgrade about the project´s progress to different audiences like municipal environmental commissions, specialists from the Ministry of Science, Technology and Environment (CITMA) in the municipalities whose communities are involved, the media and population in general, has continued
The socialization, dissemination and awareness project´s activities that have been implemented, were directed to ensure that the population of the intervened areas know about the project’s actions to achieve the continuous improvement of environmental quality of the Habana Bay´s ecosystem , as well as , increase awareness and educate the inhabitants of these areas in the importance of environmental sanitation and conservation of the Luyanó river and Havana Bay, and the actions which the community can carry out to contribute to the effect. The implemented and planned measures for the mitigation of the negative environmental impacts which can be generated in the PTR Luyanó IV´s operation have also been reported. Educational activities designed to preserve the outcomes, achievements, quality of the executed works and its sustainability have been promoted by municipal environmental commissions, municipal, provincial and Bay State Working Group of Havana of CITMA specialists, various entities of the National Institute of Hydraulic Resources (INRH), Municipal Education and Culture and the Media, . The project has continued having diffusion in all the spaces related with the environmental management and the rehabilitation of the Havana´s Bay, through local, national and regional media (radio and television), magazines and newspapers (Pelicano, Granma, Juventud Rebelde, Tribuna, Trabajadores, Somos Jovenes, www. habanaradio.cu. www radiococo. icrt. cu, ), national and international events, confirming the need and importance of WTP Luyano´s IV for the Havana bay ‘s rehabilitation
Dissemination materials with different experiences, achievements and challenges of the Environmental Management in the Bay of Havana were published by the state working group of the Havana´s Bay.

description.narrative: Reduction of pollution levels and pollutant discharges into Havana Bay, especially nutrients, with efficiency of removal of 50-70%.

comment.narrative: Nutrients N: 32 mg/l P: 9 mg/l
The best alternative has been selected and the reuse of the sludge is under process.

The National Institute of Hydraulic Resources (INRH) have been working in the valuations of alternatives for the sludge´s use.
A process of coordinations and involvement of Ministry of the Agriculture (MINAGRI), for analyzing the potentialities of sludge´s use in the agriculture, as well as providing policies and regulations which the sludge for these uses must comply.
A contract has been signed by the WTP Luyanó IV´s Investor with CIMAB to perform a new physical - chemical characterization of wastewater which will be treated in the WTP Luyanó IV, including heavy metal’s indicators.
This characterization will facilitate a better understanding of the characteristics of the sludge that will be produced in the WTP Luyanó IV.
This indicator has been systematically supervised in the WTP Luyanó IV´s controls during this period.

description.narrative: Demonstration projects focusing on recycling of nutrients and energy from waste and wastewater
Reduction of pollution levels and pollutant discharges into Havana Bay, especially nutrients, with efficiency of removal of 50-70%.

comment.narrative: Nutrients N: 32 mg/l P: 9 mg/l
Water saving toilets and separation of black-water/grey-water installed and working properly.

The zero emission building is totally inhabited and in exploitation. The separate hydraulic systems for grey and black waters are functioning. The water saving toilets have been operating. Currently, the vacuum pump (for running vacuum toilets) is out of order. This situation has not resolved yet and has continued operating with the traditional alternative installed in the 8 apartments with vacuum toilets.

description.narrative: Reduction of pollution levels and pollutant discharges into Havana Bay, especially nutrients, with efficiency of removal of 50-70%.

comment.narrative: Nutrients N: 32 mg/l P: 9 mg/l
The program for technology transfer executed.
The technology transfer program has been executed. The separate treatment of black and gray water has been implemented and operating, including the installation and operation of the saving toilets

description.narrative: Reduction of pollution levels and pollutant discharges into Havana Bay, especially nutrients, with efficiency of removal of 50-70%.

comment.narrative: Nutrients N: 32 mg/l P: 9 mg/l
The Wetland System developed and under use
The wetland is operating satisfactorily with subsequent reuse of treated water

description.narrative: Reduction of pollution levels and pollutant discharges into Havana Bay, especially nutrients, with efficiency of removal of 50-70%.

comment.narrative: Nutrients N: 32 mg/l P: 9 mg/l
The program for survey, monitoring and research established.

The proposal of the environmental, social and economic impacts assessment of the demonstrative project The Zero Emission building , basedin the operative experience, and including the characterization´s treated wastewaters was presented by the CTDMC to the National Office Project (Provincial Delegation of CITMA in Havana city, for it approval.
This proposal was evaluated and approved by the Delegation CITMA in Havana, including these studies in the project´s planning in 2016.
These studies will allow to know if the implementation of this demonstrative experience is feasible in other towns of the province or the country (in sensitive areas from the environmental ´s point of view, example: with deficit of water supply, urbanizations which don't possess and/or don't admit construction´s local sewer system systems, communities which are distant from the municipal wastewater treatment systems)
This evaluation will contribute to the Final evaluation and Report of the Project

description.narrative: The effectiveness and efficiency of SLM initiatives in Cuba is maximized programme-wide
Proportion of the core target group of 25 key institutions nationwide which is participating in the coordinated and integrated use of lands based on sustainable land management principles

comment.narrative: 18 members of the core target group by end of year 7 25 members of the core target group by end of Program

38 institutions are participating in the implementation of the CPP. During this last period 8 new institutions over the reported until June 30, 2014 were added due to: start the project CPP 2; beginning of the preparation stage of the Project Document project CPP 3; and the extension of the actions of SLM across the country.
The new entities are: UMA Holguín, UMA Tunas, UMA Stgo. De Cuba, UMA Ciego de Ávila, UMA I. Juventud, Univ. Pedagógica Villa Clara, Univ. PR, IPU Villena Revolución.

description.narrative: Proportion of area covered by CPP where agreements for coordination between national, provincial and municipal authorities for the use of lands based on sustainable land management principles are developed and in place

comment.narrative: No systems exist specific to SLM
50% of national territory covered by agreements by year 5, 70% by year 8 and 80% by year 10

The 54.2 % of national territory. In this last period actions on SLM were replicated in 91 municipalities outside the CPP Intervention Areas. (45 additional municipalities, relative to the previous period).

description.narrative: Institutions coordinate their SLM initiatives effectively programme-wide
Number of CPP projects whose startup responds to the achievement of milestones identified in the CPP document

comment.narrative: 5 (100%), throughout the life of the CPP

3 Projects (60%). Project 5 are under implementation. Project 1 is concluded implementation, final evaluation was satisfactory. Project 2 is implemented since May 12, 2015. The project 3 continues in its development phase PRODOC.

description.narrative: Number of constituent projects within the CPP which meet their impact targets in a cost-effective manner

comment.narrative: 80%, throughout the life of the CPP

91 % (average CPP-5 & CPP-P1). CPP-5 met its impact targets to 83%, CPP-1 met its impact targets to 99%, and CPP-2 is starting its implementation, since it began in May 2015. CPP-P1 technically he closed in November 2014 and financially closed in November 2015, and done the objectives proposed by the project. The CPP-2 formally began to be implemented from the inception workshop, all actions related to their stage of PPG were fulfilled successfully and satisfactorily PRODOC was approved.
CPP-3 is in the development phase of the PRODOC. Also the preparation stage PRODOC, the drafting of logical framework, and the letter CEO; the work plan and procurement plan of the PPG stage was realized. All this demonstrates a good relation cost-effective of CPP projects.

description.narrative: Degree of coincidence between activity targets established in annual work plans of CPP and constituent projects, and actual execution

comment.narrative: 90%, throughout the life of the CPP
Degree of coincidence between activity targets established in annual work plans of CPP 94.6% and constituent projects, and actual execution: (Project 1 - 98%; project 2 - 90.0% and Project 5 - 95.9%)

description.narrative: Degree of coincidence between financial targets established in annual budgets of CPP and constituent projects, and actual execution.

comment.narrative: 90%, throughout the life of the CPP

(P1- GEF funds execution 97.3%+ co financing execution 281.4% total execution P1 265.2%; P2- GEF funds execution 100%+ co financing execution 191.6% total execution P2 - 147.6%; P5 - GEF funds execution 99.4%+ co financing execution GoC 85.4%, total execution P5 91.9 %)

description.narrative: Proportion of planned CPP staff and institutional staff seconded to projects in place and satisfying performance requirements

comment.narrative: 5 full time and 3 part time members of the central team
100% (6 full time and 6 part time staff of the central team, 4 project leaders and 5 intervention area staff)

93% . The Central Coordination Unit has undergone some changes at this stage and has been strengthened with other 5 members. So 13 full-time members and two part-time are counted. Organized: A director of CPP, a specialist and a financial technique, 6 SLM specialists, one designer, one computer scientist and two drivers (full time). 2 Specialists for Handling Units

description.narrative: Number of national and international institutions (both within and outside the CPP), which coordinate with and complement GEF-funded investments in the CPP in their initiatives and plans related to SLM

comment.narrative: All 25 members of the core target group, all 46 key collaborating institutions and 4 international agencies

42 institutions. At this stage we add another 3 national institutions and continue relations with UNEP, FAO, UNDP. We held a second exchange with IADIZA in Mendoza, Argentina and began sharing experiences with specialists and producers of ABE (Mangrove) and JAICA (south of Havana) projects and strengthening the experiences with basal and PVR projects.

description.narrative: Proportion of local stakeholders in area covered by CPP who are satisfied with CPP decisions, results and products

comment.narrative: 50% in year 3, 60% in year 5, 80% from year 7 on.

Total satisfaction 87,5%,
90,0 % with decisions, 85,0 % with results and 87,5 % with products.
In the latter period, as a result of the strengthening of the project management unit, with 6 additional members, shows that have been more precise decisions in managing the project and the CPP. Respect to the results reflect a slight decrease mainly given for the delay in the start of projects 2 and 3 respectively, and the prolongation of the project 1. In general was observed an improvement in the perception of the management of CPP

The 25 members of the core target group continue to receive updated information on SLM and project progress. Access to information remains continuous through web sites as DeserCuba , InfoGEO part of the M&E system of the CPP as well as to the and the Repository of SLM with the results of national research of science and technology linked to SLM.
40 institutions are receiving and sending information linked to SLM and different aspects on desertification and drough.

The 25 members of the core target group

42 institutions take into account programme-level indicators in their management of initiatives contributing to SLM, this year the University of Pinar del Río, and Villena Technological Institute were incorporated. There are other 8 institutions outside the initial target group and already taken into account in their plans and programs SLM initiatives.

description.narrative: 1. Número de diagnósticos y de estrategias regionales elaboradas para cada cadena seleccionada: (maíz, frijol, carne y leche). 2. Número de provincias y municipios que cuentan con mecanismos intersectoriales activados para gestionar las cadenas. 3. Sistematizada metodología para el diagnóstico de cadenas agroalimentarias en el contexto cubano. 4. Número de actores sensibilizados en enfoque de cadenas y capacitados en formulación de proyectos de intervención. 5. Número de actores sensibilizados en enfoque de cadenas y capacitados en formulación de proyectos de intervención.

comment.narrative: 1. Número de diagnósticos y estrategias regionales elaboradas para cada cadena seleccionada: 0 2. Número de provincias y municipios que cuentan con mecanismos intersectoriales activados para gestionar las cadena: 0 3. Sistematizada metodología para el diagnóstico de las cadenas agroalimentarias en el contexto cubano: 4 4. Número de actores sensibilizados en enfoque de cadenas y capacitados en formulación de proyectos de intervención: 0 5. Número de actores sensibilizados en enfoque de cadenas y capacitados en formulación de proyectos de intervención: 0

1. 2 diagnósticos regionales publicados que identifican los cuellos de botellas de las cadenas seleccionadas. 2. Fortalecidas las capacidades e institucionalidad de los 13 grupos intersectoriales activados para la gestión de las cadenas de leche, maíz, carne y frijol. 3. Divulgada la metodología utilizada para el diagnóstico de las cadenas agroalimentarias en al menos 3 eventos nacionales y/o internacionales. 4. 50 actores locales capacitados para la incorporación de temas transversales (género y eficiencia energética) en la formulación de las propuestas de intervención. 5. 100 propuestas de intervención locales seleccionadas para ser financiadas en apoyo al mejor desempeño de las cadenas.

1. Publicado diagnóstico de la cadena de valor del frijol común en Cuba. Estudio de su situación en siete municipios de las provincias Sancti Spíritus y Villa Clara. El diagnóstico de la carne vacuna se encuentra en fase de diseño para la publicación. 2. 13 grupos técnicos municipales que integran a los diversos eslabones de la cadena fortalecieron sus capacidades. 3. Presentados los resultados del proyecto Agrocadenas y la metodología para el diagnóstico en 6 eventos: Universidad 2016 (organizado por el Ministerio de Educación Superior, MES, en La Habana), AgroCentro 2016 (Organizado por la Universidad Central de Las Villas), V Congreso Internacional de Mejoramiento Animal (Organizado por el Instituto de Ciencia Animal), Taller "Papel de las cadenas de valor en el desarrollo territorial" (organizado por la Fundación Tierra Integral en Murcia, España), LXI Reunión Anual del Programa Cooperativo Centroamericano para el mejoramiento de cultivos y animales (Costa Rica) y Taller temático regional sobre Cadenas de Valor y Cambio Climático (Ecuador). 4. 189 actores locales capacitados (54 mujeres) en conceptos y metodologías para contribuir a cerrar brechas de género con los proyectos locales elaborados para mejorar las cadenas; y 178 actores locales (68 mujeres) en conceptos y metodologías para abordar la eficiencia energética en proyectos locales para mejorar las cadenas. 5. 281 proyectos locales elaborados para mejorar la gestión y el desempeño de las cadenas y 117 seleccionados para ser financiados, en apoyo al mejor desempeño de las cadenas.

1. 2 diagnósticos regionales publicados que identifican los cuellos de botellas de las cadenas seleccionadas. 2. Fortalecidas las capacidades e institucionalidad de los 13 grupos intersectoriales activados para la gestión de las cadenas de leche, maíz, carne y frijol. 3. Divulgada la metodología utilizada para el diagnóstico de las cadenas agroalimentarias en al menos 3 eventos nacionales y/o internacionales. 4. 50 actores locales capacitados para la incorporación de temas transversales (género y eficiencia energética) en la formulación de las propuestas de intervención. 5. 100 propuestas de intervención locales seleccionadas para ser financiadas en apoyo al mejor desempeño de las cadenas.

1. Publicado diagnóstico de la cadena de valor del frijol común en Cuba. Estudio de su situación en siete municipios de las provincias Sancti Spíritus y Villa Clara. El diagnóstico de la carne vacuna se encuentra en fase de diseño para la publicación. 2. 13 grupos técnicos municipales que integran a los diversos eslabones de la cadena fortalecieron sus capacidades. 3. Presentados los resultados del proyecto Agrocadenas y la metodología para el diagnóstico en 6 eventos: Universidad 2016 (organizado por el Ministerio de Educación Superior, MES, en La Habana), AgroCentro 2016 (Organizado por la Universidad Central de Las Villas), V Congreso Internacional de Mejoramiento Animal (Organizado por el Instituto de Ciencia Animal), Taller "Papel de las cadenas de valor en el desarrollo territorial" (organizado por la Fundación Tierra Integral en Murcia, España), LXI Reunión Anual del Programa Cooperativo Centroamericano para el mejoramiento de cultivos y animales (Costa Rica) y Taller temático regional sobre Cadenas de Valor y Cambio Climático (Ecuador). 4. 189 actores locales capacitados (54 mujeres) en conceptos y metodologías para contribuir a cerrar brechas de género con los proyectos locales elaborados para mejorar las cadenas; y 178 actores locales (68 mujeres) en conceptos y metodologías para abordar la eficiencia energética en proyectos locales para mejorar las cadenas. 5. 281 proyectos locales elaborados para mejorar la gestión y el desempeño de las cadenas y 117 seleccionados para ser financiados, en apoyo al mejor desempeño de las cadenas.
